page.title: 09DAY OF A FARMER
page.content: {Mr Greenlaw}is a{farmer.}In spring he gets up about{6:30 am}and has breakfast, then goes down to the farm. He feeds the{cattle}and{sheep}then he gets the{International tractor}and {levels}the ground for sowing the {barley.}He stops for his dinner at {12:00}and starts at{12:45.}When finished levelling he starts to sow. When he is finished it is time to feed the cattle. After he is finished he goes home for his tea. If he is busy he goes back to work. He fills the tractor with{diesel}and rolls the field. If he didn't do that all the {crows}would eat the seed. After he is finished he goes home, reads the{paper and watches the{news.}just before he goes to bed he has a cup of{tea}or {coffee. {by Alan Greenlaw (Age 11)
